## Scene 1:
Mei's private chamber with view of the street

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[1.1.cA] (WIDE, Eye Level)
The silk curtains flutter against the carved wooden lattice as [CHAR_MEI] kneels beside her window, fingers tracing the intricate patterns that separate her from the world below.
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[1.2.cA] (MEDIUM, Eye Level)
Through the delicate openwork, she watches the [LOC_PRESSED_DIRT_ROAD] where merchants hawk their wares and children chase each other between the wheels of ox-carts.
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[1.3.cA] (CLOSE-UP, Eye Level)
Her chamber in the [LOC_LU_XIAN_BROTHEL_DIR_W] represents the finest luxury—jade ornaments catching afternoon light, embroidered cushions soft as clouds, a mahogany writing desk inlaid with mother-of-pearl. Yet the beauty feels hollow, like a beautiful tomb designed for the living.
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[1.4.cA] (MEDIUM, Eye Level)
"Mei, child, come away from that window." [CHAR_MADAME_CHOU]'s voice carries the authority of twenty years managing the most prestigious establishment in the district.
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[1.5.cA] (WIDE, Eye Level)
She enters with measured steps, her silk robes rustling like autumn leaves.
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[1.6.cA] (MEDIUM, Eye Level)
"Today we must discuss your future. The negotiations have narrowed to two serious suitors."
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

[CHAR_MEI] doesn't turn from the window immediately. Below, she can see the corner where morning light always catches the edge of [LOC_FLORIST_SHOP], though the building itself remains hidden from this angle. 

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[1.8.cA] (EXTREME CLOSE-UP, Eye Level)
Her heart quickens at the thought of the gentle hands she's observed from her higher perch, tending to blossoms with such infinite care.
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[1.9.cA] (MEDIUM, Eye Level)
"Two suitors," she repeats softly, her breath fogging the wooden slats.
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

"And what of what I might want?"

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[1.10.cA] (MEDIUM, Eye Level)
[CHAR_MADAME_CHOU] settles onto a cushion, her expression mixing maternal concern with business pragmatism. "Want is a luxury we cannot afford, precious one. But choice—choice between honor and greater honor—this I can offer you."
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

She pauses, studying [CHAR_MEI]'s profile. "The merchant [CHAR_MIN_ZHU] has increased his offer significantly. And General Zhao promises a household befitting your refinement."

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[1.12.cA] (MEDIUM, Eye Level)
[CHAR_MEI] finally turns, her dark eyes holding secrets [CHAR_MADAME_CHOU] cannot fathom.
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[1.13.cA] (MEDIUM, Eye Level)
"And what if I told you my heart already belongs elsewhere?"
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

The older woman's face hardens almost imperceptibly. "Then I would remind you that hearts are luxuries courtesans cannot afford."

## Scene 2:
Lin's modest shop with wooden shelves displaying potted flowers and hanging baskets

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[2.1.cA] (WIDE, Eye Level)
The late afternoon sun filters through the open doorway of [LOC_FLORIST_SHOP_DIR_E], casting golden rectangles across the worn wooden floor where [CHAR_LIN] kneels beside a collection of ceramic pots. His movements carry the unhurried precision of someone who has found his calling—fingers checking soil moisture, adjusting a drooping stem, repositioning a pot to catch better light.
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[2.2.cA] (MEDIUM, Eye Level)
The shop smells of earth and growing things, jasmine and chrysanthemums creating a perfume far more honest than the incense that permeates the [LOC_LU_XIAN_BROTHEL].
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

"There now," he murmurs to a struggling orchid, his voice barely above a whisper. "You just needed a little more shade, didn't you?" He relocates the delicate plant to a shelf where dappled sunlight won't overwhelm its petals. His calloused hands, stained with soil and plant sap, handle each bloom as if it were made of spun glass.

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[2.3.cA] (MEDIUM, High Angle)
From her elevated window several buildings away, [CHAR_MEI] presses closer to the lattice, her heart racing as she watches this daily ritual she has memorized.
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[2.4.cA] (CLOSE-UP, Eye Level)
She cannot hear his words, but she sees the gentleness in his posture, the way he pauses to truly observe each plant's needs. This is what tenderness looks like, she realizes—not the practiced seduction she has been taught, but genuine care given freely, expecting nothing in return.
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[2.5.cA] (MEDIUM, Eye Level)
[CHAR_LIN] straightens, wiping his hands on a cloth, and for a moment glances toward the upper windows of the district. The sensation of being watched prickles at the edge of his consciousness, though he cannot identify its source.
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[2.6.cA] (MEDIUM, Eye Level)
He returns to his flowers, unaware that somewhere above, a young woman is falling in love with his kindness.
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

## Scene 11:
Mei's private chamber, dawn light filtering through the lattice

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[11.1.cA] (WIDE, High Angle)
The first pale light of dawn seeps through the carved lattice of [CHAR_MEI]'s chamber, casting delicate shadows across her tear-stained face as she kneels motionless beside the window. Sleep has not come—cannot come—when the weight of her failure presses against her chest like a stone. The twin lanterns she glimpsed burning in [LOC_FLORIST_SHOP] through the night have finally dimmed, leaving only the memory of hope extinguished.
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[11.2.cA] (MEDIUM, Eye Level)
A soft scratching at her door breaks the morning silence. [CHAR_MADAME_CHOU] would never knock so tentatively, and the servants know better than to disturb her before the sun fully rises. [CHAR_MEI] wipes her eyes with silk sleeves and moves to the door with practiced grace, though her heart hammers against her ribs.
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[11.3.cA] (CLOSE-UP, Eye Level)
"Please," comes a gentle voice from the corridor, barely above a whisper. "I received your message. The lanterns burned all night, but you never came."

[CHAR_MEI]'s breath catches in her throat. Through the wooden door, she recognizes the voice that has spoken only to flowers in all her months of watching. [CHAR_LIN] has somehow found his way to the [LOC_LU_XIAN_BROTHEL_DIR_E], navigating the maze of streets and social barriers that separate their worlds.
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[11.4.cA] (MEDIUM, Eye Level)
She opens the door to find him standing in the dim hallway, soil still beneath his fingernails, eyes wide with concern and confusion.
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[11.5.cA] (CLOSE-UP, Eye Level)
In his calloused hands, he holds a small potted orchid, its white petals luminous in the half-light. "I brought this," he says simply. "Something told me you might need beauty today."
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[11.6.cA] (CLOSE-UP, Eye Level)
The sight of him—real, solid, gentle as she had imagined—nearly breaks her remaining composure. "You shouldn't be here," she whispers, though every fiber of her being wants to pull him inside, to tell him everything, to beg him to take her away from this gilded prison.
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[11.7.cA] (MEDIUM, Eye Level)

I don't understand, but..." He extends the orchid toward her, its delicate blooms trembling slightly. "I know how to care for fragile things."
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[11.8.cA] (CLOSE-UP, Eye Level)
[CHAR_MEI] accepts the flower, her fingers brushing his for one electric moment. The touch burns through her like lightning, confirming every dream she has harbored about this gentle soul.
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[11.9.cA] (MEDIUM, Eye Level)
But behind her, the chamber holds the evidence of her defeat—the contract signed in [CHAR_MIN_ZHU]'s bold hand, the silk robes that mark her as property, the window that frames her captivity.
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

(/scene_frame_chunk_start/)
[11.10.cA] (MEDIUM, Eye Level)
"You must go," she says, though the words tear at her throat like broken glass. "This place... I am not what you think. Not free to choose, not worthy of such kindness." She steps back, creating distance that feels like death itself. "Find someone who can return your care, who can tend gardens beside you in the sunlight."
(/scene_frame_chunk_end/)

[CHAR_LIN]'s face fills with gentle confusion, sensing the pain beneath her formal words but unable to comprehend its source. "Everyone deserves tenderness," he says quietly. "Even orchids that bloom in shadows."
